headline: Show HN: nbsnapshot – Snapshot testing for Jupyter notebooks
description:
I want to share a project I've been working on to facilitate Jupyter notebook testing (https://github.com/edublancas/nbsnapshot).

When analyzing data in a Jupyter notebook, I unconsciously memorize "rules of thumb" to determine if my results are correct. For example, I might print some summary statistics and become skeptical of some outputs if they deviate too much from what I've seen historically. For more complex analysis, I often create diagnostic plots (e.g., a histogram) and check them whenever new data arrives.

Since I constantly repeat the same process, I figured I'd code a small library to streamline this process. nbsnapshot benchmarks cell's outputs with historical results and raises an error if the output deviates from an expected range (by default, 3 standard deviations from the mean).

To learn more, check out the blog post (https://ploomber.io/blog/snapshot-testing/).

I quickly put together this as a proof of concept and would love to learn if this sounds useful for other notebook users so I spend more time working on it. Please share your feedback!

headline_zh-Hant: Show HN: nbsnapshot - Jupyter筆記本的快照測試
description_zh-Hans:
我想分享我一直在进行的一个项目，以促进Jupyter笔记本的测试（https://github.com/edublancas/nbsnapshot）。

当在Jupyter笔记本中分析数据时，我不自觉地记住了"经验法则"来确定我的结果是否正确。例如，我可能会打印一些汇总统计，如果一些输出结果与我在历史上看到的偏差太大，我就会对它们持怀疑态度。对于更复杂的分析，我经常创建诊断图（例如。

由于我经常重复同样的过程，我想我应该编写一个小的库来简化这个过程。 nbsnapshot将单元格的输出与历史结果进行比较，如果输出偏离预期范围（默认为平均值的3个标准差），则会引发错误。）

要了解更多信息，请查看博文（https://ploomber.io/blog/snapshot-testing/）。

我很快就把这个东西放在一起作为概念证明，并希望了解这听起来是否对其他笔记本用户有用，所以我花了更多时间来研究它。请分享您的反馈!
